contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Expert-subject|date=March 2011}} '''SS-N-16 ''Stallion''''' refers to a [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] 650 mm [[anti-ship missile]] that was deployed between 1979 and 1981. The name is a combination of the American designation of ''SS-N-16'' and the [[NATO]] term of ''Stallion'' for Soviet RU-100s. It refers to either # '''RPK-6 Vodopad''' ({{Lang-ru|РПК-6 Водопад}}, "waterfall") - Surface ship version<br />or # '''RPK-7 Veter''' ({{Lang-ru|РПК-7 Ветер}}, "wind") - Submarine version The 53.3 cm version carried either the 82R torpedo or the 90R [[Nuclear depth bomb|nuclear depth charge]]. The 65 cm version carried the 83R torpedo or 86R nuclear depth charge. Serving dual roles, the missile could be outfitted with either an RU-100 Veter, a 20 [[kiloton]] nuclear warhead for use against surface ships, or alternatively an RU-100 Vodopad, a Type-40 [[torpedo]] for use against [[submarine]]s.{{clarify|date=March 2011}}<!-- So could you have a "Vodopad" missile with a "Veter" payload and vice versa? Or did the sub verison always use a nuke? Or has there been some mix-up? --> Its increased range of up to 120 kilometres offered an impressive boost over its predecessor the [[SS-N-15|SS-N-15 Starfish]], which could only reach half the distance; although it meant refitting all the old 533 mm torpedo tubes to carry this new 650 mm torpedo. ==Specifications== Dimensions: * Length: 6.5 m (21 ft 4 in) * Diameter: 64.8 cm (25.5 in) * Weight: 2150 kg (4,740 lbs) Performance: * Speed: Mach 1.5 * Range: 120 km (74.6 mi) Payload: * 200-kT nuclear depth bomb or 533 mm (21 inch) torpedo ==Operators== ;{{USSR}} *[[Soviet Navy]] ;{{RUS}} *[[Russian Navy]] {{Russian and Soviet missiles|SSM}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ss-N-16}} [[Category:Cold War anti-ship missiles of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Anti-submarine missiles]] [[Category:Anti-ship missiles of the Soviet Union|RPK-006]] [[Category:Anti-ship missiles of Russia|RPK-007]] [[Category:Surface-to-surface missiles]] {{Missile-stub}}
